clues.name: GreenPositiveGreen
clues.content: I hire- %pardon me,% hired [Victim] as my personal doctor since I could expedite his services. | I have no patience for being sick.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] liked [Victim]'s expedite-able medical services.

clues.name: GreenNegativeGreen
clues.content: [Victim] may have been my personal doctor, but I assure you that it was purely out of necessity.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] used [Victim]'s services out of necessity.

clues.name: GreenPositiveYellow
clues.content: [Yellow] liked [Victim] enough to place her late husband in his care.  I'd say that's proof enough of their relationship.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] thinks: [Yellow] liked [Victim] enough to let him care for her husband when he was sick.

clues.name: GreenNegativeYellow
clues.content: Ah, yes.  It's tragic really.  [Yellow]'s husband died under [Victim]'s care. | I'd be surprised if she'd already forgiven him.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] thinks: [Yellow] hates [Victim] since her husband died under his care.

clues.name: GreenPositiveRed
clues.content: Hm, I'd compare [Victim] and [Red]'s relationship to that of business partners.  [Victim] traded supplies from far lands in exchange for [Red]'s impressive art. | The partnership appeared mutual to me, so I doubt that [Red] would murder her supplier.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] thinks: [Red] and [Victim] had a mutual supply partnership.

clues.name: GreenNegativeRed
clues.content: [Red] may have a sharp mind for business, but her acute temper does her no favors. | When faced with [Victim]'s nigh-existent filter, [Red]'s professionalism always melted to something far uglier.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] thinks: [Red] and [Victim] viciously argued over everything.

clues.name: GreenPositiveBlack
clues.content: [Black]'s tone may seem to contradict this statement, but he does care for the lives of those in this town. | I suppose it's natural then that he respects [Victim] for saving those lives time and again.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] thinks: [Black] respects [Victim]'s work in saving lives.

clues.name: GreenNegativeBlack
clues.content: [Black] and [Victim]?  Well, [Victim] took pleasure in publicly denouncing God, and yet [Black] had to rely on the doctor for his own health. | Relationships are rarely as deeply flawed as that, don't you think, detective?
clues.journalSummary: [Green] thinks: [Black] was angered by [Victim]'s hate of religion.

clues.name: GreenPositiveBlue
clues.content: The psychological effect of [Victim]'s visits are almost tangible.  The sick cured, generally everyone is happier. | Naturally, [Victim]'s visits are essentially [Blue]'s days off.  Considering his lazy nature, I'd be surprised if [Blue] took issue with [Victim] and his visits.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] thinks: [Blue] took days off to relax when [Victim] visited town.

clues.name: GreenNegativeBlue
clues.content: [Blue] has been unrequitted by [Yellow] for some time now.  Perhaps, if a rumor is to be believed, because she was already in bed with [Victim]. | Now, while I find gossip disgusting, I expect you to realize that [Blue] being jealous of [Victim] is an important clue.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] thinks: [Blue] likes [Yellow]; [Blue]'s jealous of [Victim]'s relationship with [Yellow].

clues.name: YellowPositiveGreen
clues.content: I don't know about their personal life, but I know that [Victim] only comes into town when [Green] expedites him. | [Green] must really prefer [Victim] to be his doctor.  Don't you think, honey?
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] thinks: [Green] likes [Victim] if [Green] pays to expedite him.

clues.name: YellowNegativeGreen
clues.content: Well, I really shouldn't be saying anything, dearie.  But, [Victim] and [Green] were at odds over [Green]'s business practices.
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] thinks: [Green] and [Victim] are on bad terms over business practices.

clues.name: YellowPositiveYellow
clues.content: [Victim]? Oh, yes.  He tried his hardest to save my husband... | I can't fault him though, he stayed with us until my husband's final breath. | ... | I'm sorry dearie, that was a tad somber.  Anything else?
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] doesn't hold [Victim] at fault for her husband's death.

clues.name: YellowNegativeYellow
clues.content: He seems like a kind man.  However, %and pardon my bluntness, honey,% [Victim] is not a good doctor. | He is what we had though.  I doubt anyone is looking forward to the upcoming months without a doctor.
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] thinks [Victim] is a bad doctor.

clues.name: YellowPositiveRed
clues.content: Oh, those two got along well enough.  [Victim] always seemed to buy from her when in town.
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] thinks: [Victim] was a good customer to [Red].

clues.name: YellowNegativeRed
clues.content: I really shouldn't say anything, but... | Well, [Victim] was a very outspoken athiest, and you know [Red], hot tempered and religious. | I can't imagine their conversations lasted long or ended well.
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] thinks: [Red] and [Victim] fought over conflicting views on religion.

clues.name: YellowPositiveBlack
clues.content: Ah, yes, the friar didn't seem to have any major problems with [Victim]. | In fact, he seemed less sour than usual when [Victim] was in town.  Probably took some of the stress of death off his mind.
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] thinks: [Black] was calmed to have a doctor in town.

clues.name: YellowNegativeBlack
clues.content: [Victim] was an atheist, not that there's anything wrong with that of course. | Well, in anycase, [Black] and [Victim] didn't see eye to eye on a lot of things.
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] thinks: [Victim]'s atheism conflicted with [Black]'s catholicism.

clues.name: YellowPositiveBlue
clues.content: [Blue] always seemed to take more time off at my bakery when [Victim] came around. | I think he felt more relaxed knowing someone else was handling the pressure of the townsfolk.
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] thinks: [Blue] liked having [Victim] act as another caretaker for the town.

clues.name: YellowNegativeBlue
clues.content: Oh, that [Blue].  His face turns red as an apple pie when he sees [Victim] at my bakery. | [Victim] seems very respectful and is always such a sweetie to me.  I can't imagine why [Blue] wouldn't like him.
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] is jealous of [Victim].  [Yellow] thinks: [Blue] has no reason to dislike [Victim].

clues.name: RedPositiveGreen
clues.content: [Green] has the money to expedite [Victim]'s services whenever he wants. | [Victim] liked the money, [Green] liked the not-dying-from-illness.  It worked for them.
clues.journalSummary: [Red] thinks: [Green] likes [Victim]'s services enough to expedite him.

clues.name: RedNegativeGreen
clues.content: [Victim] and [Green] practically disagreed on everything, so [Green] just paid him to be a hypocrit while in town. | It didn't stop [Victim] though.  Half the good gossip about [Green] came indirectly from [Victim] himself. | [Victim] had some real guts.
clues.journalSummary: [Red] thinks: [Victim] and [Green] didn't like each other but put it aside for business.

clues.name: RedPositiveYellow
clues.content: Oh, please.  [Yellow] doesn't "dislike" people.  She just likes some people more. | She's just thankful that [Victim] helped her husband until the end.
clues.journalSummary: [Red] thinks: [Yellow] is thankful to [Victim] for caring for her husband.

clues.name: RedNegativeYellow
clues.content: Can't blame her for hating [Victim]. | With the amount of money that [Victim] took despite failing to save [Yellow]'s husband, I'd hate the bastard too.
clues.journalSummary: [Red] thinks: [Yellow] hates [Victim] for being charged heavily after failing to save her husband.

clues.name: RedPositiveRed
clues.content: [Victim] wasn't so bad.  He supplied me with materials, and I sold him the resulting products.
clues.journalSummary: [Victim] supplied [Red].

clues.name: RedNegativeRed
clues.content: I was suspicious at best of that scumbag.  I think [Victim] only shopped at my store so I'd have enough money to pay for his medical services.
clues.journalSummary: [Victim] was a manipulative and arguative buyer of [Red]'s supplies.

clues.name: RedPositiveBlack
clues.content: The friar may not like most people, but he couldn't find it in him to hate someone that's done so much good for the town. | Especially since [Victim] is practically keeping [Black] alive at this point.
clues.journalSummary: [Red] thinks: [Black] appreciates the good that [Victim]'s done for the town.

clues.name: RedNegativeBlack
clues.content: [Black]'s getting old, everyone knows it.  He basically relied on [Victim] to keep him going through the winters. | Problem is, [Victim] didn't have the time to head here every flu season.  Three guesses on how [Black] took that news.
clues.journalSummary: [Red] thinks: [Black] and [Victim] got in a fight about [Black]'s age.

clues.name: RedPositiveBlue
clues.content: %Tch.% [Blue] spends his whole day at [Yellow]'s bakery when the doctor's in town. | He must think the doctor's gonna fix everything while hits on that widow.
clues.journalSummary: [Red] thinks: [Blue] relies on [Victim] to care for the town when [Victim] visits.

clues.name: RedNegativeBlue
clues.content: As messed up as it sounds, there's a rumor that [Yellow] had a thing for [Victim], at least at some point. | %(sigh)% Doesn't matter if [Victim] returned the feelings or not, [Blue] is completely jealous of him.
clues.journalSummary: [Red] thinks: [Blue] holds a jealous hatred for [Victim] because both of them like [Yellow].

clues.name: BlackPositiveGreen
clues.content: It always seemed like [Victim] was at his beck and call. | Even when they differed in opinion, [Green] always insisted on having [Victim] as his doctor.
clues.journalSummary: [Black] thinks: [Victim] was always at [Green]'s beck and call.

clues.name: BlackNegativeGreen
clues.content: Would you truly expect a critic of alcohol and a vintner to get along?
clues.journalSummary: [Black] thinks: [Green] the vintner is at odds with [Victim] the critic of wine.

clues.name: BlackPositiveYellow
clues.content: Even those who do not follow the Lord must find solace in something. | Her comfort was found in [Victim] tending to her husband until the end.
clues.journalSummary: [Black] thinks: [Yellow] appreciated [Victim] taking care of her husband until his death.

clues.name: BlackNegativeYellow
clues.content: The week after Mr. Yellow died, she spoke to me for advice.  She showed concern that [Victim] may not have tried to save her husband. | The poor misguided soul has not since returned to the church.
clues.journalSummary: [Black] thinks: [Yellow] blames [Victim] for her husband's death.

clues.name: BlackPositiveRed
clues.content: Their relationship appears to have been that of supply partners. | [Red]'s high quality art supplies often came from [Victim] importing them to [Red] when he visits, so I doubt that their relationship was too sour.
clues.journalSummary: [Black] thinks: [Red] and [Victim] were strong supply partners.

clues.name: BlackNegativeRed
clues.content: I understand her disdain for [Victim].  She is a child of the Lord, and [Victim] has publicly denouced religion. | What would you do if someone publicly denouced your way of life?
clues.journalSummary: [Black] thinks: [Red] dislikes [Victim] for denouncing religion.

clues.name: BlackPositiveBlack
clues.content: The doctor is a blessing to many here, and his visits inspire increased attendence to the church. | I would never curse the converts that his visits bring.
clues.journalSummary: [Victim]'s visits cause increased church attendence.

clues.name: BlackNegativeBlack
clues.content: [Victim] was less than religious.  I believe he was a fool to reject the Lord. | Look where that landed him.
clues.journalSummary: [Black] blames [Victim]'s death on his rejection of religion.

clues.name: BlackPositiveBlue
clues.content: I would be surprised to find out that [Blue] would want [Victim] gone. | He would have to work twice as much to deal with the citizens stressed by the loss of their most consistent doctor.
clues.journalSummary: [Black] thinks: [Blue] misses the security of having a doctor if things go wrong.

clues.name: BlackNegativeBlue
clues.content: I cannot imagine that [Blue] cares for the man who promotes abstinence. | His confessionals, though, reveal a deeper hate of [Victim].  Why though, he would not say.
clues.journalSummary: [Black] thinks: [Blue] deeply hates [Victim] for promoting abstinence and for something else.

clues.name: BluePositiveGreen
clues.content: [Green]'s the only one who can seem to get [Victim] to visit, %when he was alive%. | Why else would [Victim] visit on [Green]'s request if they didn't like each other?
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] thinks: [Green] must like [Victim] since he requested his visits so often.

clues.name: BlueNegativeGreen
clues.content: [Green] liked wine, %who can blame him,% and [Victim] didn't.  What is there to figure out?
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] thinks: [Green] and [Victim] had differing views on alcohol.

clues.name: BluePositiveYellow
clues.content: No, I don't think [Yellow] hates [Victim]. | [Yellow]'s sweet, y'know? ([Blue]'s staring past you smiling)
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] thinks: [Yellow] doesn't hate [Victim].

clues.name: BlueNegativeYellow
clues.content: I dunno.  Why are you askin' me about [Yellow]? %not like she talks to me anyway% | Well, she's been a bit colder to me since her husband died.  Maybe she blames [Victim] for his death?
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] thinks: [Yellow] blames [Victim] for her husband's death.

clues.name: BluePositiveRed
clues.content: %(sigh)% Geez, why should I know? | I guess I saw [Victim] purchasing supplies from [Red] each time he was in town.  %Not like I'm her keeper or anything.%
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] thinks: [Victim] was a consistent customer of [Red]'s.

clues.name: BlueNegativeRed
clues.content: Why do you think I'd know everyone's business? | I guess she's mentioned her distaste for him.  She got sick once and couldn't get a checkup from him. %something like that.%
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] thinks: [Red] dislikes [Victim] because he couldn't get a checkup from him once.

clues.name: BluePositiveBlack
clues.content: Oh, that old man?  I think he only liked [Victim] because he was a doctor. ([Blue] gives a noncommital shrug)
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] thinks: [Black] liked that [Victim] was a doctor.

clues.name: BlueNegativeBlack
clues.content: I think [Victim] gave the old man some news he didn't quite like. | Ever since a particular meeting, [Black] seems too angry for words when [Victim] is brought up.
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] thinks: [Black] is infuriated by something [Victim] told him.

clues.name: BluePositiveBlue
clues.content: With such a small town, folk get paranoid without a local doctor. %especially when sick.% | But when [Victim] was around, everyone calmed down. %saved me so much trouble.%
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] likes how everyone remained calm when [Victim] was around.

clues.name: BlueNegativeBlue
clues.content: [Victim] was a playboy for the ages.  He couldn't keep his hands off of [Yellow]. | I'm not happy that he's dead though. %but at least she won't be harassed anymore.%
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] doesn't like [Victim] because he thinks [Victim] harassed [Yellow].

clues.name: GreenPositiveGlove
clues.content: Am I right-handed?  No, I am left-handed. | A bloody glove, you say?  Well unless it's covered in grape-juice instead of blood, then I doubt that would be mine. | Good find detective, you seem very close to the killer now.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] is right-handed, so he couldn't have murdered [Victim].

clues.name: GreenNegativeGlove
clues.content: Am I left-handed?  Yes, I am. | Oh, you found a bloody glove, did you?  And this means what, detective? | I'm growing tired of your passive nature, detective.  Next we meet, you'd do well to either clear me or arrest me, but do not waste my time.
clues.journalSummary: [Green] is left-handed, like the killer's glove.

clues.name: YellowPositiveGlove
clues.content: I'm right-handed, honey, not left.  Why do you ask, honey? | You found the killer's right-handed glove and it's covered in blood?  How horrid! | Oh my, that does clear my name though, right dearie? | I'm so proud of your progress so far.  Keep it up, dearie, you're almost to the end of this case!
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] is right-handed, so she couldn't have murdered [Victim].

clues.name: YellowNegativeGlove
clues.content: I am right-handed.  Why do you ask, honey? | You found a right-handed glove, and it's covered in blood?  Oh dear. | I have only tried to help you detective, yet you seem set on me being a prime suspect. | I was investigated after Mr. Yellow's death, and just like then, my name will be cleared. | Do you understand me, dearie?
clues.journalSummary: [Yellow] is right-handed, like the killer's glove.

clues.name: RedPositiveGlove
clues.content: My dominant hand?  Left.  ...Why do you ask? | You found the killer's glove, eh? I see how it is. | You're here to clear my name!  Thanks bud.  Turns out you're not so bad after all. | Good luck with the others.  Let me know how else I can help the case.
clues.journalSummary: [Red] is left-handed, so she couldn't have murdered [Victim].

clues.name: RedNegativeGlove
clues.content: My dominant hand?  Left.  ...Why do you ask? | You found the killer's glove, eh? I see how it is. | You think I did it, just like everyone always does. | Y'know what?  No.  Get the hell out of my sight! | And don't you dare come back without a warrant for the killer's arrest!
clues.journalSummary: [Red] is left-handed, like the killer's glove.

clues.name: BlackPositiveGlove
clues.content: A glove, you say? | Were you here to clear my name, or to cast more doubt upon it, child? | Well, I regret to inform you that I am ambidextrous, therefore you can do neither. | You still have some work to do, child.  You had better do it.
clues.journalSummary: [Black] is ambidextrous, so the killer's glove says nothing about him.

clues.name: BlackNegativeGlove
clues.content: A glove, you say? | Were you here to clear my name, or to cast more doubt upon it, child? | Well, I regret to inform you that I am ambidextrous, therefore you can do neither. | You still have some work to do, child.  You had better do it.
clues.journalSummary: [Black] is ambidextrous, so the killer's glove says nothing about him.

clues.name: BluePositiveGlove
clues.content: You think you found one of my gloves, babe? | Oh, you found the murderer's glove?  %Don't get my hopes up like that.% | Well, I'm right-handed, so this couldn't be mine. | Hey, if I'm no longer a suspect, then that means you're getting closer to solving this thing!  Good job, babe!
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] is right-handed, so he couldn't have murdered [Victim].

clues.name: BlueNegativeGlove
clues.content: I'm right-handed, can't you tell, babe? | You think you found one of my gloves, then? | Hey, hey, hey, this is a glove from the case isn't it? | Haven't you gotten it through your skull that I'm one of the town guards?  Circumstantial evidence isn't direct evidence, detective. | %I knew they should've put me on this case.%
clues.journalSummary: [Blue] is right-handed, like the killer's glove.
